events.message: Customer reported a vehicle collision that occurred on a busy downtown street, requesting immediate claim initiation.
The claim was classified under Auto Accident category after reviewing the initial report and vehicle incident details.
An experienced claims agent was assigned to manage the case ensuring prompt and thorough handling of the auto accident claim.
The customer was sent an acknowledgment confirming receipt of the car accident claim and next steps to be taken.
Request for police report, vehicle damage photos, and insurance papers was sent to the claimant to proceed with investigation.
Customer uploaded all requested documents including the police report and pictures of the damaged vehicle for review.
Assigned investigator began reviewing submitted evidence and contacting involved parties to verify accident circumstances.
Investigation concluded successfully confirming the claimant was not at fault in the vehicle collision incident.
A fair settlement amount was proposed based on damage assessments and repair cost estimates provided by third parties.
Claimant expressed satisfaction with timely updates and clarity throughout the claim process after reviewing the settlement terms.
The claim was officially approved following the customer’s acceptance of the proposed settlement for the auto accident damages.
Settlement payment was processed and issued to the claimant’s bank account to cover all repair expenses of the vehicle.
The auto accident claim was officially closed after confirmation that payment was received and repairs were scheduled.
All claim files and documentation were archived securely in the company system for future reference and audit purposes.
